snippet: The Coogan’s five-kilometer race, a fixture on the New York road running scene for more than a decade as it evolved into a neighborhood party in Washington Heights, may have run its course.
abstract: Coogan’s five-kilometer race, a fixture on the New York road running scene for more than a decade as it evolved into a neighborhood party in Washington Heights, is in jeopardy as organizer Peter Walsh steps aside; neither New York Road Runners nor the Armory Foundation have indicated a willingness to take it over.
lead_paragraph: The Coogan’s five-kilometer race, a fixture on the New York road running scene for more than a decade as it evolved into a neighborhood party in Washington Heights, may have run its course.

headline.seo: Coogan’s 5K in Jeopardy as Organizer Steps Aside
headline.main: Manhattan Race in Jeopardy as Its Organizer Steps Aside
headline.print_headline: Manhattan Race in Jeopardy As Its Organizer Steps Aside
